subject: running a single JUnit  test in Eclipse
msgSnippet: I have a test class with two methods, each prefixed with @Test.  In Eclipse I right-click on one of these methods and select Run As Unit Test .  It runs both
messageBody:
I have a test class with two methods, each prefixed with @Test. In
Eclipse I right-click on one of these methods and select "Run As Unit
Test". It runs both methods, not just the one I clicked on. This is
using the JUnit that comes with Eclipse Ganymede out of the box.

Is this how it supposed to work? I was expecting it to run only the
one method on which I right-clicked. Is my expectation incorrect?

I'm working on a custom Runner. If the user does what I did above, I
see how the test runner gets notified of the class, but not the name of
the method. I've seen some JUnit 4 docs talking about filtering, so I
thought maybe the JUnit framework would look through the Description
object returned by the runner and only execute the method which the
user right-clicked. The class JUnit4TestMethodReference does save a
Description object that contains the method name, but I don't see where
that is used. Am I missing something?

-Sam
